content.description: This problem starts sitting on obvious good edges and breaks right towards the arete via tiny crimps underclings, and toe hooks.
content.location: Sit start at the center of the only boulder in the canyon, on the north-facing overhang that faces the creek, new the mine cart. It is 60 meters downstream of the Pool.

content.description: Climb the fun vertical face to below a roof. Pull through the roof (crux) and continue up the steep face to the chains.
content.location:
This is just to the left of

Colorfest

.

content.description: This is another good beginner climb, although it has a tricky topout.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Middle Man's

all black bolts and left of a small arete.

content.description:
This route has a powerful boulder problem in the first two bolts with easier, juggy climbing after that. It shares an anchor with

Jesus Freak

.

The crux moves felt like mid-12 to me, but it's so short, and I'm sure there's an easier way to do it. If anyone has any more details on this route, please add it.
content.location:
It is the steeper bolted line just right of the classic 5.9 juggy corner (

One Summer's Eve

), and it shares an anchor with

Jesus Freak

to the right.

content.description: This is kind of a neat, little, crack and stemming, beginner route.
content.location:
It is two routes to the right of

Middle Man

and the black bolts, just to the right of a crack/corner system.

content.description:
This relatively new route is a powerful and technical 5.12 route just left of the classic 5.11 "

Close To The Edge

". It would be wise to stickclip the first bolt and anchor your belayer or you may find yourself in or your belayer stuck over "the sea" as I did. The initial overhang starts the 5.12 climbing at the second bolt with some steep sidepulling to turn the roof, a tough clip, then a powerful sequence with two pairs of crimps that are quite far apart. Make a difficult clip and a few more hard moves up the arete to reach a rest between bolt 4 and 5. Make a tricky mantel move, then finish on easier but engaging climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: Currently, there are four permadraws to start the route, but you will need three more draws to reach the lowering hook anchor. I met Marcus the day I climbed this, and he said he will be adding more permadraws to complete it soon. Please update this as those are added!
content.location:
It is just around the corner and first route to the left of "

Close To The Edge

". Marcus told me that there is another sport route he established that traverses further left and is about 12c.

content.description:
This route starts near the pool in an alcove. Climb up in the corner on good holds, then move right onto the face and up to a three bolt anchor.

In

November 2021, the rock to the right of the first couple bolts fell down in a major rockfall.

Photo by D. Wright.
content.location: Start very close to the pool in a shallow alcove/corner.

content.description: No Idea has a high first bolt. Climb the easy, and slightly dirty start up to the obvious large ledge. Clip the first bolt on the face, and continue following the bolt line.. The climbing gets harder towards the middle of the face through the top on some smaller holds and not the best feet.
content.location:
It is just left of

Babel

.

content.description:
Middle Man is a five bolt sport route that is just right of the

Funky Crack

.
content.protection: Bolts and top anchor hooks for lowering.
content.location:
It is in the Pool area. The bolts and hangers are spray painted black. It shares an anchor with

Funky Crack

.

content.description:
The bottom section starts with lots of moss and dirt. Layback the dihedral while trending rightwards through a series of edges, min-overlaps, and laybacks before joining the ledge and anchor of

Over The Sea

. This actually cleaned up well, and the climbing is fun. It is great for a TR fitness afterburner. Leading it would be interesting for the belayer.
content.location:
It is left of

Over the Sea

, directly over the pool.

content.description: This route is shorter than most of the others in the Pool Area, the anchor is situated a little more than halfway up the wall.  However the climbing is similar to neighboring routes, steep limestone.  It can be a little dirty.
content.location: It is towards the left end of the Pool Area, maybe about the third route right of the pool.

content.description: Climb the vertical limestone face, trending up and slightly right.
content.location: Located towards the right end of the "Pool Area". It is the first route to the right of the roof that its neighbors to the left go through.

content.description: This is a broken and varied, mostly finger-sized crack with lots of face features to use as well. The crack can be a little dirty from runoff.
content.location:
This is towards the Pool. It is to the right of

One Summer's Eve

. It is pretty easy to spot the crack.

content.description:
Bolted by Erik Durgin, this route goes up the impressive roof that caps the Colorfest cliffband.

Do the first awkward crux of ''

Freak Show

'', rest up, and start making your way up a face that gets harder and harder. Fire up the roof on incredible pinches, finishing on a blind slam dunk move to the lip.

This uses classic Cascade style involving a lot of trickery with heel hooks and dropknees. Overall, it is one of the best hard routes around, and I'm hoping that putting it here will encourage people to get on it.
content.location:
Start on ''

Freak Show

'', but keep going straight up to the obvious roof.

content.description: Start up an arete, then some face moves to below a roof. Pull the roof on good holds, and finish at chains.
content.location: Start uphill and to the right of the pool at an arete/corner near a large boulder.

content.description: Climb up the easy face to the crux roof move (finding the holds can be the hardest part), then pull better holds to the top.
content.protection: Pretty sewn up, bring lots of draws.  Some of the bolts look a bit old.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Answer to the Master

and left of

Gods of Thunder

.

content.description: This has a highball start; the crux is at the third bolt.
content.location: It is right next to the pool.

content.description: This route is often dirty and/or wet. Climb past one bolt to the top of a pillar, continue up the steep face to the roof, pull the roof and finish up with more steep face.
content.location:
This is towards the center of the Wall, a little to the left of

The War Has Started

and

Colorfest

.

content.description: Climb up small edges on close to vertical rock, then make a bigger move over a roof.  It is easier but somewhat tiring climbing to the anchors.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Colorfest

, at the left side of the big boulder.
